admreg: Europe and Central Asia,Europe and Central Asia

abstracts.cdata!:
The  Albania Private Industry Recovery
            Project ratings are as follows:  Project outcome is
            satisfactory; sustainability is likely; institutional
            development impact is modest; Bank performance is overall
            satisfactory; and Borrower performance is overall
            satisfactory.  The lesson learned was the following:  An
            agency was established by legislation and a staff of six
            persons was employed to implement the project. As it
            eventuated, activity was not adequate to keep the staff
            fully and actively employed except in the set up period of
            training and the initial marketing. The Project Appraisal
            Document envisaged that the agency would be able to continue
            in existence after the project closed as a guarantee agency
            and provide support for cross border trade including export
            credit insurance. The project description in Part B of
            Schedule 2 envisaged the continuation of the project in the
            form of a guarantee agency unsupported by the World Bank but
            only after the project had closed at the end of January
            2003. The form of insurance or guarantees envisaged by Part
            B, such as export credit insurance, are related but more
            complex functions than providing political risk only
            guarantees. In retrospect, the objectives of the Project
            would have been better achieved by allowing the agency
            during the project implementation period to use the project
            funds on other related activities such as export credit
            insurance, subject to similar controls and restrictions as
            applied in the use of political risk insurance.
